text.6: يَوْمَىِٕذٍ يَّصْدُرُ النَّاسُ اَشْتَاتًا ەۙ لِّيُرَوْا اَعْمَالَهُمْۗ
text.7: فَمَنْ يَّعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَّرَهٗۚ
text.8: وَمَنْ يَّعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَّرَهٗ ࣖ

text.1: Apabila bumi diguncangkan dengan guncangan yang dahsyat,
text.2: dan bumi telah mengeluarkan beban-beban berat (yang dikandung)nya,
text.3: Dan manusia bertanya, “Apa yang terjadi pada bumi ini?”
text.4: Pada hari itu bumi menyampaikan beritanya,
text.5: karena sesungguhnya Tuhanmu telah memerintahkan (yang sedemikian itu) padanya.
text.6: Pada hari itu manusia keluar dari kuburnya dalam keadaan berkelompok-kelompok, untuk diperlihatkan kepada mereka (balasan) semua perbuatannya.
text.7: Maka barangsiapa mengerjakan kebaikan seberat zarrah, niscaya dia akan melihat (balasan)nya,
text.8: dan barangsiapa mengerjakan kejahatan seberat zarrah, niscaya dia akan melihat (balasan)nya.

text.1: When the earth is shaken with its [final] convulsion,
text.2: And the earth discharges its burdens,
text.3: And man says, "What is [wrong] with it?" -
text.4: That Day, it will report its news
text.5: Because your Lord has inspired it.
text.6: That Day, people will depart separated [into categories] to be shown [the result of] their deeds.
text.7: So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it,
text.8: And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.

id.name: Kemenag
id.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah mengungkapkan bahwa bumi bergeletar dan berguncang sedahsyat-dahsyatnya, sebagaimana diterangkan firman Allah dalam ayat lain:

Wahai manusia! Bertakwalah kepada Tuhanmu; sungguh, guncangan (hari) Kiamat itu adalah suatu (kejadian) yang sangat besar. (al-hajj/22: 1)

Apabila bumi diguncangkan sedahsyat-dahsyatnya. (al-Waqi'ah/56: 4).

Keterangan ini menunjukkan tentang dahsyatnya keadaan ketika itu. Hal itu dimaksudkan untuk menarik perhatian orang-orang kafir agar memikirkan dan merenungkannya. Seakan-akan dikatakan kepada mereka bahwa apabila bumi sebagai benda padat bisa bergeletar dengan dahsyat pada hari itu, maka mengapa mereka sendiri tidak mau sadar dari kelalaian dengan meninggalkan kekafirannya.
text.2:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah menyatakan bahwa pada hari terjadi kegun-cangan itu, karena dahsyatnya, bumi menghamburkan isi perutnya yang terpendam berupa logam, harta simpanan, dan mayat-mayat dari kubur. Dalam ayat lain, Allah berfirman:

Dan apabila bumi diratakan, dan memuntahkan apa yang ada di dalamnya dan menjadi kosong. (al-Insyiqaq/84: 3-4)

Contohnya, sebagaimana terjadi dengan letusan gunung Krakatau pada tahun 1883, gempa dan tsunami di Aceh pada tahun 2004, lumpur panas di Sidoarjo Jawa Timur sejak tahun 2006, dan lain-lain yang begitu dahsyat sehingga mengeluarkan lava dan isi perut bumi. Guncangan pada hari kiamat jauh lebih dahsyat lagi.
text.3:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah mengungkapkan bahwa orang-orang yang mengalami dan menyaksikan kejadian yang dahsyat dan membuat terperanjat orang-orang yang melihatnya, berkata, "Apa gerangan yang terjadi pada bumi. Ini belum pernah terjadi sebelumnya?" Dalam ayat lain, Allah berfirman:

Dan kamu melihat manusia dalam keadaan mabuk, padahal sebenarnya mereka tidak mabuk. (al-hajj/22: 2)
text.4:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah menyatakan bahwa ketika terjadinya keguncangan yang dahsyat itu, saat bumi bergetar dan mengalami kehancuran serta kerusakan, seakan-akan ia menjelaskan kepada manusia bahwa kejadian yang belum pernah terjadi ini tidak menurut ketentuan yang berlaku bagi alam semesta dalam keadaan biasa.

Allah menjelaskan bahwa sebab terjadinya keguncangan tersebut adalah atas perintah-Nya semata. Ketika bumi diperintahkan hancur, maka bumi akan hancur luluh.

Pada dasarnya ayat 1-5 di atas berkenaan dengan hari kiamat. Namun dari sekala lebih kecil ayat-ayat tersebut dapat ditafsirkan dengan proses geologi terjadinya gempa, yang sudah barang tentu besarannya jauh lebih kecil dibanding kejadian kiamat kelak.

Seperti telah dijelaskan sebelumnya menurut kajian ilmiah bahwa lempengan-lempengan kulit bumi bergerak dan saling berinteraksi satu sama lain. Pada tempat-tempat saling bertemu, pertemuan lempengan ini menimbulkan gempa bumi. Sebagai contoh adalah Indonesia yang merupakan tempat pertemuan tiga lempeng: Eurasia, Pasifik, dan Indo-Australia. Bila dua lempeng bertemu, maka terjadi tekanan (beban) yang terus menerus, dan bila lempengan tidak tahan lagi menahan tekanan (beban) tersebut, maka lepaslah beban yang telah terkumpul ratusan tahun itu, dan dikeluarkan dalam bentuk gempa bumi.

Pada hari itu bumi 'menceritakan beritanya. Beban berat yang dikeluarkan dalam bentuk gempa bumi, merupakan satu proses geologi yang berjalan bertahun-tahun. Begitu seterusnya, setiap selesai beban dilepaskan, kembali proses pengumpulan beban terjadi. Proses geologi atau berita geologi ini dapat direkam baik secara alami maupun dengan menggunakan peralatan geofisika ataupun geodesi (lihat juga an-Naml/27: 88, ath-thur/52: 6). Telaah tentang gempa bumi dapat dilihat pula pada Surah an-Naba'/78: 17-20.

text.6: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa pada hari terjadinya kerusakan dan kehancuran bagi bumi serta terjadinya alam baru dan hidup baru, muncullah manusia dalam keadaan yang berbeda-beda dan berkelompok. Orang-orang yang beramal baik tidak sama dengan orang-orang jahat. Orang-orang yang taat tidak sama dengan orang yang berbuat maksiat. Mereka muncul untuk diperlihatkan Allah kepada mereka apa yang telah mereka lakukan dan untuk memetik hasil usaha mereka selama hidup di dunia.
text.7: Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah merincikan balasan amal masing-masing. Barang siapa beramal baik, walaupun hanya seberat atom niscaya akan diterima balasannya, dan begitu pula yang beramal jahat walaupun hanya seberat atom akan merasakan balasannya. Amal kebajikan orang-orang kafir tidak dapat menolong dan melepaskannya dari siksa karena kekafirannya. Mereka akan tetap sengsara selama-lamanya di dalam neraka.

en.name: The Earthquake
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1:
In this verse, Allah reveals that the earth will tremble and shake with extreme intensity, as explained in Allah's word in another verse:

"O mankind! Fear your Lord. Indeed, the convulsion of the Hour is a terrible thing." (al-Hajj/22:1)

"When the earth is shaken with a [terrible] shaking." (al-Waqi'ah/56:4).

This explanation indicates the awfulness of the situation at that time. It is intended to draw the attention of the disbelievers to think and reflect upon it. It is as if it is said to them that if the earth, as a solid object, can tremble violently on that day, then why do they themselves refuse to awaken from their negligence by abandoning their disbelief?
text.2:
In this verse, Allah states that on the Day when the earth is shaken, due to its intensity, it will throw out its hidden contents, such as metals, buried treasures, and corpses from graves. In another verse, Allah says:

And when the earth is leveled and throws out what is within it and becomes empty. (al-Insyiqaq/84: 3-4)

For example, as happened with the eruption of Mount Krakatoa in 1883, the earthquake and tsunami in Aceh in 2004, the hot mudflow in Sidoarjo, East Java since 2006, and others that were so devastating that they released lava and the earth's contents. The shaking on the Day of Judgment will be far more devastating.
text.3:
In this verse, Allah reveals that those who experience and witness the terrible event that startles those who see it, will say, "What has happened to the earth? This has never happened before?" In another verse, Allah says:

And you see the people as intoxicated, while they are not intoxicated. (al-hajj/22: 2)
text.4:
In this verse, Allah states that when the tremendous upheaval occurs, when the earth shakes and experiences destruction and damage, it is as if it is explaining to mankind that this unprecedented event does not conform to the rules that apply to the universe in its normal state.

Allah explains that the cause of this upheaval is solely by His command. When the earth is commanded to be destroyed, it will be utterly destroyed.

Basically, verses 1-5 above relate to the Day of Judgment. However, on a smaller scale, these verses can be interpreted in terms of the geological process of earthquakes, which are of course much smaller in magnitude than the events of the Day of Judgment.

As explained previously, according to scientific studies, the earth's crustal plates move and interact with each other. At the points where they meet, this plate convergence causes earthquakes. An example is Indonesia, which is the meeting point of three plates: Eurasia, Pacific, and Indo-Australia. When two plates meet, continuous pressure (load) occurs, and when the plates can no longer withstand the pressure (load), the load that has accumulated for hundreds of years is released and discharged in the form of an earthquake.

On that day, the earth 'tells its news'. The heavy load released in the form of an earthquake is a geological process that takes place over many years. And so on, every time the load is released, the process of accumulating the load begins again. This geological process or geological news can be recorded both naturally and using geophysical or geodetic equipment (see also an-Naml/27: 88, ath-thur/52: 6). A study of earthquakes can also be seen in Surah an-Naba'/78: 17-20.
text.5:
In this verse, Allah states that when that tremendous convulsion occurs, when the earth trembles and experiences destruction and ruin, it is as if it is explaining to mankind that this unprecedented event does not conform to the rules that apply to the universe in its normal state.

Allah explains that the cause of this convulsion is solely by His command. When the earth is commanded to be destroyed, then the earth will be utterly destroyed.

Basically, verses 1-5 above relate to the Day of Judgment. However, on a smaller scale, these verses can be interpreted in terms of the geological process of earthquakes, which are of course much smaller in magnitude than the events of the Day of Judgment.

As explained previously, according to scientific studies, the earth's tectonic plates move and interact with each other. At the points where they meet, this plate convergence causes earthquakes. An example is Indonesia, which is the meeting point of three plates: Eurasia, Pacific, and Indo-Australia. When two plates meet, there is continuous pressure (load), and when the plates can no longer withstand this pressure (load), the load that has accumulated for hundreds of years is released, and discharged in the form of an earthquake.

On that day, the earth 'tells its news.' The heavy load released in the form of an earthquake is a geological process that takes place over many years. And so it continues, every time the load is released, the process of accumulating the load begins again. This geological process or geological news can be recorded both naturally and using geophysical or geodetic equipment (see also an-Naml/27: 88, ath-thur/52: 6). A study of earthquakes can also be seen in Surah an-Naba'/78: 17-20.
text.6: In this verse, Allah explains that on the day of destruction and ruin for the earth, and the emergence of a new realm and new life, humanity will appear in different states and groups. Those who did good deeds will not be the same as the wicked. The obedient will not be the same as those who committed disobedience. They will appear so that Allah may show them what they have done and to reap the rewards of their efforts during their life in this world.
text.7: In these verses, Allah details the recompense for each deed. Whoever does good, even if only the weight of an atom, will certainly receive its reward, and likewise, whoever does evil, even if only the weight of an atom, will feel its recompense. The good deeds of the disbelievers cannot help them or release them from punishment because of their disbelief. They will remain miserable forever in hell.
